meanings.definition: Gunking (verb): to cover or coat with a thick, sticky substance
meanings.sent1: She was gunking the table with glue to make a craft project.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was gunking the engine with oil to keep it running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The kids were gunking each other with silly string at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The rain was gunking the windows, making it hard to see outside.
meanings.sent5: The chef was gunking the cake with frosting, creating a delicious masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The old shed was covered in gunking from years of neglect.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally stepped in a puddle of gunking on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The gunking on the floor looked like a colorful art installation.
meanings.sent4: The swamp was full of dark, murky gunking that bubbled up with each step.
meanings.sent5: The jar was filled with a strange, bubbling gunking that nobody could identify.

meanings.definition: Gunking (adjective): covered or coated with a thick, sticky substance
meanings.sent1: The gunking walls of the old house were in desperate need of a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent2: His shoes were gunking from walking through the muddy field.
meanings.sent3: The gunking candy apple was too sticky to eat without making a mess.
meanings.sent4: The car windshield was gunking with dried bug splatters, obstructing the view.
meanings.sent5: The dog came back from the park, gunking with mud from head to tail.
